subject_terms_3: Portrait photography Lim, Herbie Eng Kwan
physical_appearance: The image shows ten images. Eight of them are in black-and-white while the other two are in colour. All of the images show a bespectacled man's face and his upper torso. He is dressed in a suit and tie. The photographs are of different sizes. The photographs on the left depict the man when he was younger, while the ones on the right depict the man when he was older.
sgcool_label_text: These ten photographs are portraits of Herbert Lim Eng Kwan (1927-2002),  Chairman of Singapore Tourist Association from 1967 to 1970, and founder and managing director of Jackie's Bowl for over 20 years. ‘Herbie’ was the son of the Peranakan businessman Lim Chong Pang (1904 – 1956) and grandson of the pineapple and rubber planter and prominent philanthropist Lim Nee Soon (1879 – 1936).
title_text: Passport portraits of Herbert Lim Eng Kwan
subject_terms_2: Black-and-white photography Portrait photography Colour photography Men
